meanings.definition: Satisfied with what one is or has; not wanting more or anything else.
meanings.sent1: She felt content after finishing her meal.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked content curled up by the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The content puppy wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The garden seemed content with the gentle rain.
meanings.sent5: The child's smile was a picture of content happiness.

meanings.definition: The substance or material dealt with in a speech, literary work, etc., as distinct from form or style.
meanings.sent1: The content of the book was about friendship.
meanings.sent2: The content of the presentation was informative.
meanings.sent3: The content of the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The content of the song touched the listeners' hearts.
meanings.sent5: The content of the painting was vibrant and colorful.

meanings.definition: The amount of a particular constituent in something.
meanings.sent1: The sugar content in the drink was too high.
meanings.sent2: The content of vitamins in the fruit was beneficial.
meanings.sent3: The content of salt in the dish was overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The content of water in the pool was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The content of laughter in the room was contagious.
